content: the pebble headband 1 the pebble headband by kelly littlewood of peak & prairie knits created by peak & prairie knits the pebble headband 2 craft type knitting craft style headband skill level beginner/easy yarn any super bulky size 6 yarn i use lion brand wool-ease thick & quick other yarns used malabrigo rasta sugarbush chill weareknitters the wool see modifications section below if you wish to use a different yarn needles us 15/10mm 16 circular needles extras 1 stitch marker tapestry needle weaving ends scissors logo tag abbreviations co cast on bobble bind off k knit p purl sm stitch marker st stitch sizing chart size # stitches to cast on # of row baby 0-3 months 29 10 baby 3-6 months 31 10 baby 6-12 months 33 12 toddler 35 14 child 39 16 teen 41 17 adult 43 18 adult + 45 20 created by peak & prairie knits the pebble headband 3 pattern refer to the sizing chart above to decide which size you are wishing to create 1 co number of st as listed in chart for your size example making the adult size you will co 43 st you may cast on in any way you feel comfortable i personally prefer the long-tail cast-on method 2 join st in the round you may wish to use a sm to help keep track of each bor row 1 k1 p1 row 2 p1 k1 repeat row 1 & 2 until you reach the number of row as listed in the chart for your size * be aware that whatever row you end on is not critical for the project as it is knit in seed stitch 3 after your last row bind off using a simple knit bind off if you have another method you feel more comfortable with or prefer to use go ahead with that method be cautious to not bind off too tightly try to keep it approximately the same as your cast on 4 when you reach the end of your bind off leave a long enough tail 15 inches and cut the yarn use your darning needle to weave this yarn through all the last stitches pull tight and secure yarn as you normally would weave in any other loose ends modifications this pattern is really simple when you get the hang of it cast on is in un-even number of stitches to get the seam-less look of the toque you may wish to alter the length of the toque as you see fit feel free to alter the pattern as you see fit but please give credit design to the original designer myself kelly of peak & prairie knits please feel free to use this pattern to create stock for markets create a knitted item for a loved one or a fabulous little treat for yourself created by peak & prairie knits
